author: Lenore

review: I'm waiting for the online live chat to move to me to "1" in the queue, as I type this.  Look, when it works, it works great.  I've loved not having to pay for TV and this has (for the most part) done what it should.  However, I purchased this March 28th, 2014 and here it is January 26, 2015.  It hasn't even lasted a year, and this isn't the first time I've had issues.  Unfortunately,  when I woke up this morning I found it in a perpetual loop of ROKU sadness, where the letters bounce on the screen and then it constantly resets.  So, as I sit in the "queue" for what will probably be another 30 minutes only to have them not be able to fix this, I think the next TV stick I order will be the amazon fire.  You might get a ROKU that lasts for years, but I'm disappointed this thing didn't make it even one.
author: Jaime E. Brown

review: This is a pretty nice little device to steam tons of content off the web.  Besides being able to stream your Amazon Prime, Hulu Plus and Netflix, the Roku provides you with a ton of other free content as well.  I've had it a couple of weeks now and the more I play with the Roku the better I like it.  Definitely a great gadget to have.  Just log it into your wireless network and go.  Great picture quality in HD.

review: I have had a lot of trouble with this product. The streaming stick went bad, and was promptly replaced by Amazon. A good thing.Now it is the remote.
